newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST - Denmark sees 4.8 bln Dkk budget surplus. [CORRECTED 11:05 GMT]
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Denmark sees 4.8 bln Dkk budget surplus. [CORRECTED 11:05 GMT]

text.p: The Danish finance ministry said on Tuesday in its latest budget report that it foresaw a state budget surplus of 4.8 billion crowns for 1997.
The estimate was more (corrects from less) optimistic than its last forecast in December which predicted a 5.9 billion crown state budget surplus (corrects from deficit) for 1997.
The estimate compares with a Danish state budget deficit of 21.5 billion crowns in 1996.

"The improvement can be attributed to increased revenue from greater private and corporate taxation and value-added tax. Corporate taxation alone is expected to bring the state in almost four billion crowns more in extra revenue in 1997 than forecast last December," the ministry said in a statement.
"Many more firms than expected have chosen to pay their corporate tax by instalment," it said. --Per Bech Thomsen, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969656
